conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric/cutaway 3D model: walls extruded with thickness, multiple faces visible, and ceiling/roof removed to expose interior spaces.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable interior volumes; isometric viewpoint is appropriate with minimal distortion; cutaway is clean though some door openings/curves feel stylistic rather than strictly architectural.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match (kitchen/dining left, living center, bedrooms right, bath/laundry/closets lower zones). Minor proportional differences (e.g., hallway/door cluster and some partition lengths) and some openings do not perfectly match the 2D door swing placements.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture blocks align with expected rooms: dining table in kitchen/dining, sofas/tables in living, beds in both bedrooms, tub and vanity/toilet elements in bathroom, and kitchen counters/appliances present. A few items are simplified and not fully detailed.

visual_clarity.notes: Good separation of walls/floors/openings with consistent materials and clean background; lighting supports visibility. Minor ambiguity where stylized curved doors intersect near the hall.

detected_errors.description: Small layout/proportion drift in interior partitions (notably around the hall/closet/bathroom cluster) compared to the 2D plan.
Several doors are rendered with exaggerated curved geometry and may not exactly match the 2D door swing positions and opening widths.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, with only minor proportion and door/opening placement/style discrepancies from the 2D plan.
